intro: Krynitzkia californica, commonly known as California krynitzkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Krynitzkia californica is adapted to arid environments and has developed mechanisms to conserve water.
